name: flddivrng

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cfld), wcel(c0, cdrng))
-| wss(cfld, cdrng)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cfld), wcel(c0, cdrng))
-| wss(cfld, cdrng)

body.origin:
|- wss(cfld, cdrng)
-| wceq(cfld, cin(cdrng, ccm2))
-| wss(cin(cdrng, ccm2), cdrng)
body.pretty:
⊢ Fld ⊆ DivRingOps
⊣ Fld =(DivRingOps ⋂ Com2)
⊣ (DivRingOps ⋂ Com2)⊆ DivRingOps

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cfld), wcel(c0, cdrng))
-| wceq(cfld, cin(cdrng, ccm2))
-| wss(cin(cdrng, ccm2), cdrng)
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ Fld → c0 ∈ DivRingOps)
⊣ Fld =(DivRingOps ⋂ Com2)
⊣ (DivRingOps ⋂ Com2)⊆ DivRingOps

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cfld), wcel(c0, cdrng))
-| wss(cin(cdrng, ccm2), cdrng)

comment: A field is a division ring. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 10-Jun-2010.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-Dec-2013.) (New usage is discouraged.)
